docs.text: in my opinion one of the best films of the last few years is istvan szabo's sunshine , a film that covers the fortunes of a jewish hungarian family under the reigns of three different regimes , hungarian aristocrats , nazis , and communists .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: szabo's follow-up film , a german production , is much more limited in scope .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is about the post-war investigation of who criminally supported the nazis and who opposed them .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ronald harwood's screenplay ambiguously looks at the investigation of a great classical music conductor who stayed on in germany when the nazis took power and became the most popular conductor of the third reich .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: maj . steve arnold ( played by harvey keitel ) has been assigned by his superiors to investigate wilhelm furtwangler ( stellan skarsgard ) , perhaps europe's greatest classical music conductor .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when other artists fled germany , furtwangler remained behind and conducted for the hitler and his henchmen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after the war is over arnold assigned to interview furtwangler and members of his orchestra and if appropriate to prosecute him for war crimes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he secretly is told by his commanding officer to find furtwangler guilty .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: from there we follow him and learn a little about arnold and something about furtwangler and his orchestra .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as he interviews members of the wartime orchestra arnold starts noticing odd peculiarities that may or may not point to a conspiracy against his investigation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there is a certain sameness to the responses that he is getting .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: perhaps any cooperation he is getting has been in some ways managed .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if so , perhaps he can never come to the truth .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in large part the film is about mind games that arnold uses to manipulate his interviewees and especially furtwangler .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: where the script has problems is that in the end it is so ambiguous .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it has no obvious resolution and not much of a final act .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: when it is over whether anything has been established is open to interpretation .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: perhaps that is better than so many films that make it all to obvious what the audience should believe , but it is like watching a murder mystery and never finding out who the killer is .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: we are given clues to something but they are never tied up .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the end we just know more about both arnold and furtwangler .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film is basically a stage play .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the visual is not very important .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: corners are cut visually including touches like filling windows with photographs to avoid having to shoot on location .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as with a stage play , what this film centers on the dialog , and that is intriguing .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i rate the film an 8 on the 0 to 10 scale and a high +2 on the -4 to +4 scale .
docs.label: positive
